oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WAVE CLIMATE STUDY IN WADDEN SEA AREAS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kaiser, Ralf
Brandt, Gunther
Gartner, Joachim
Glaser, Detlef
Grune, Joachim
Jensen, Frerk
Niemeyer, Hanz D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wadden Sea
wave climate
climate study
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Significant features on Wadden Sea wave climate are evaluated in respect of the state of the art. Main emphasis was laid on an analysis of the governing boundary conditions of local wave climate in island sheltered Wadden Sea areas with extensions being sufficient for local wind wave growth. Explanatory for significant wave heights a reliable parametrization of local wave climate has been evaluated by using generally available data of water level and wind measurements.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 24 (1994): Proceedings of 24th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Kobe, Japan, 1994.
